name: 01-Introduction
content:
Shipping Bill OCR Data Extraction  ðŸš¢ðŸ“„ â†’ ðŸ“Š


Objective:  


The Shipping Bill OCR Extraction workflow automates the extraction and structuring of key data from shipping bill invoices (PDFs). It processes both summary-level details (e.g., bill number, date, port) and item-level line items (e.g., product descriptions, quantities, values) into a structured, analysis-ready CSV fileâ€”eliminating manual data entry and reducing errors.  


Approach:  


The system follows a streamlined OCR and data processing workflow:  


Data Ingestion  

  • Upload single or multiple PDF shipping bills.  
  • The system scans and extracts raw text/data using OCR (Optical Character Recognition).  


Dual-Path Data Processing  


Summary Data Extraction


Captures high-level fields:  

  • Shipping Bill Number  
  • Shipping Date  
  • Port of Origin/Destination  
  • Total Value, Weight, etc.  


Item Details Extraction


Extracts line-item specifics:  

  • Item Numbers  
  • Descriptions (e.g., product names, HS codes)  
  • Quantities, Unit Prices, and Amounts  


Cleanup & Structuring  

  • Removes redundant columns.  
  • Splits data into readable rows.  


Merging & Export  

  • Combines summary + item details into a unified table.  
  • Exports to CSV for reporting, auditing, or ERP integration.  


Benefits:  


  1. Eliminates manual copy-pasting from PDFs.  
  2. Handles complex structures (nested item lists, multi-page bills).  
  3. Standardized output for seamless integration with analytics tools.  
  4. Scalableâ€”processes 1 or 1,000+ bills with consistent accuracy.  



Expected Outcome:  


A clean, structured file with:  

  1. Header: Summary fields (bill number, date, port, totals).  
  2. Line Items: Product-level details (description, quantity, value).  
  3. Time saved: Reduces extraction time from hours to minutes.  
  4. Error reduction: Minimizes human typos and omissions.  



Use Cases:  


  • Customs clearance (automated data submission).  
  • Audit & compliance (digitized record-keeping).  
  • Logistics analytics (tracking shipment trends by port, product, etc.).
